subject: Nutrition
title: Breakfast The Most Important Meal
description: A micro-lesson that makes Breakfast The Most Important Meal usable.

hook.text: You've heard it a thousand times: never skip breakfast. The science behind that claim is weak.

buildup.text: The 'breakfast is essential' idea was promoted heavily by cereal companies in the early 1900s.

discovery.text: Observational studies link breakfast with health, but those people also exercise more and smoke less.

twist.text: Randomized trials show skipping breakfast doesn't cause weight gain and can even reduce total calories.

climax.text: For some people breakfast helps. For others, skipping works fine. There is no universal rule.

punchline.text: Cereal companies wrote the rule. Science didn't.

quiz.question: Who heavily promoted the idea that breakfast is essential?
